newsitem.title: CANADA: Campbell Resources reports Quebec drilling.
newsitem.headline: Campbell Resources reports Quebec drilling.

text.p: Campbell Resources Inc said Friday that exploration drilling at its Joe Mann mine in Quebec has interesected high grade gold mineralization.
Eight deep diamond drill holes totalling about 16,620 feet were drilled to explore the west zone of the mine, the company said in a statement.
Gold ranged between 0.023 ounces per tonne and 1.029 ounces per tonne.
Three high grade intersections more than 150 feet apart were erported within the zone, Campbell said.

The high grade intersections confirm the presence of the West Zone 1,400 to 1,800 feet below the exploration drift, suggesting potential for a significant sized deposit to the west of the main Joe Mann orebody, the company said.
